intro: Melocactus perezassoi, commonly known as the Périzzi melocactus, is a species native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stem and a crown of spines that can vary in color from yellow to red. The plant produces a single, large, red or orange flower during the spring or early summer. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often sought after by cactus enthusiasts and collectors.
